document.docAuthor: Mbanyana, Nokuthula, Garcia, Francisco Hita, Robertson, Hamish Gibson & Roux, Johannes Jacobus Le
document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of seed harvester ants of the Tetramorium solidum group (Hymenoptera: Formicidae) in southern Africa

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of seed harvester ants of the Tetramorium solidum group (Hymenoptera: Formicidae) in southern Africa

bibRefCitation.author: Emery C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Emery C. 1895. Voyage de M. E. Simon dans l'Afrique australe (janvier-avril 1893). 3 e memoire. Formicides. Annales de la Societe entomologique de France 64: 15 - 56.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Tetramorium squamiferum Forel, 1894: 80
(attributed to Emery; nomen nudum, see
Wheeler 1922: 903
; included in
Bolton 1980: 250
).

Tetramorium setuliferum var. cucalense Santschi, 1910: 356
(included in
Bolton 1980: 250
).

Tetramorium setuliferum var. triptolemus Arnold, 1917: 292
included in
Bolton 1980: 250
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Tetramorium setuliferum
is morphologically similar to
T. clunum
. The two species are separated by the characters listed under
T . clunum
.

materialsCitation.paragraph:
SOUTH AFRICA : syntypes of
Tetramorium setuliferum Emery, 1895: 2
pinned workers, Orange Free State , Bethlehem, Weitzecker leg. ( MSNG : CASENT0904839).

subSubSection.paragraph:
ANGOLA : syntypes of
Tetramorium setuliferum var. cucalense Santschi, 1910: 1
pinned worker, Cucala, Benguela , J. Cruchet leg. (RMCAENT000017786); 1 pinned worker, Cucala near Caconda, Benguela , 31 Dec. 1910 , Santschi leg. ( NHMB : CASENT0915077; MNHN : CASENT0915425).

ZAMBIA : syntype of
Tetramorium setuliferum var. triptolemus Arnold, 1917: 1
pinned worker, “N. Rhod.” according to label, Lusakas, Oct. 1913 , G. Arnold leg. ( BMNH : CASENT0901177).

Eastern Cape
: Stutterheim, 3 May 1993 , W. Coetzer leg. (SAM-HYM-C006786).

NAMIBIA (60 pinned specimens): miscellaneous foragers, just outside Opuwo, open savanna on white clay soil, 14 Mar. 1995 , H.G.Robertson leg. (SAM-HYM-C009176); foragers,Waterberg Rest Camp, bare ground outside bungalow, 16 Mar. 1995 , H.G. Robertson leg. (SAM-HYM-C009241); Waterberg area, Klarwater Farm, on sand, C. Dickman leg. (SAM-HYM-C006268); Avis Dam, Windhoek, 22°34.925′ S , 17°08.134′ E , nest in soil, entrance in open, 14 Apr. 2011 (SAM-HYM-C026798); Porcupine Camp, 8 km W of Kamanjab, 19°38.950′ S , 14°45.952′ E , 10 Apr. 2011 , nesting in deep fine red sandy soil, nest entrance with crater of soil around, N. Mbanyana and H.G. Robertson leg. (SAM-HYM-C027093); Porcupine Camp, 8 km W of Kamanjab, 19°38.969′ S , 14°45.971′ E , 10 Apr. 2011 , nesting in sandy soil, nest entrance in the open with crater of soil around, N. Mbanyana and H.G. Robertson leg. ( SAM- HYM-C027094); Zelda Guest Farm site 1, 22°17.311′ S , 19°49.199′ E , 16 Apr. 2011 , nest in sandy soil, entrance in the open, with crater of soil around it, males collected from the nest, N. Mbanyana and H.G. Robertson leg. (SAM-HYM-C027096); Zelda Guest Farm site 4, 22°16.596′ S , 19°49.701′ E , 16 Apr. 2011 , nest in soft sandy soil, entrance at base of grass tuft, N. Mbanyana and H.G. Robertson leg. ( SAM- HYM-C027097); 61.2 km S of Gobabis, C20 site 3, 22°56.806′ S , 18°44.681′ E , 17 Apr. 2011 , nest in red sandy soil, N. Mbanyana and H.G. Robertson leg. (SAM-HYM-C027099).

BOTSWANA : Nata Saltpan, 2 km into saltpan, 1 Dec. 1986 , R.J. Nefdt leg. (SAM-HYM-C000295); Madikwe Game Reserve, Tshwene
Combretum apiculatum
mountain field, 24°44′43″ S , 26°17′14″ E , Jan. 2001 , N. Govender leg. (SAM-HYM-C016269).

ZIMBABWE : Rusape, 18.32° S , 32.08° E , 5 Dec. 1987 , collected from nest, H.G. Robertson leg. (SAM-HYM-C000817); Kyle View Chalets, 20.05° S , 31.01° E , 30 Nov. 1987 , collected from nest, H.G. Robertson leg. (SAM-HYM-C000770); Noga Island Okavango Delta, sand, 23 Sep. 1991 , R. Newman leg. (SAM-HYM-C005634); Khami Ruins, 14 mi. W of Bulawayo , 22. Mar. 1958 , 1275 m a.s.l., E.S. Ross and R.E. Leech leg. ( CASC : CASENT0270795); Oshikongo, 3200 ft (= 975 m ) a.s.l., 9 Mar. 1970 , E.S. Ross leg. ( CASC : CASENT0270796).

ZAMBIA : Gwabe Camp near Chirundu, 20 Dec. 1986 , R.J. Nefdt leg. (SAM-HYM-C007280); Lusaka , Xanadu Farm, in soil about 10 cm deep, Miomba woodland, legume-like seeds in nest, 2 Jan 1987 , R.J. Nefdt leg. (SAM-HYM-C000298); Choma, 16°47.72´S , 26°56.30´E , 1330 m a.s.l., 3 Dec. 2005 , Fisher et al. leg. ( CASC : CASENT0066874).
SWAZILAND : foragers, 5 km NE of Forbes Reef, grassland, 26°8′ S , 31°8′ E , 19 Feb. 1999 , on ground, P.S. Ward leg. (SAM-HYM-C016538).

This is a widespread and common species in savanna and grassland regions of southern Africa, including South Africa ( Western Cape , Northern Cape , Eastern Cape , KwaZulu-Natal , Mpumalanga , Limpopo , Gauteng , North West , Free State ), Angola , Botswana , Lesotho , Malawi , Mozambique , Namibia , Tanzania , Zaire , Zambia and Zimbabwe . It has been recorded from the following ecoregions: Angolan Mopane Woodlands, Drakensberg Montane Grasslands, Highveld Grasslands, Kalahari Xeric Savanna, Kalahari
Acacia –Baikiaea
Woodlands, Maputaland-Pondoland Bushland and Thickets, Nama Karoo, Namibian Savanna Woodlands, Southern Africa Bushveld, Southern Africa Mangroves, Southern Miombo Woodlands, Succulent Karoo, Zambezian and Mopane Woodlands, Zambezian Flooded Grasslands.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 21.
Tetramorium setuliferum Emery, 1895
(MCZ_ENT00512567). A . Body in profile. B . Body in dorsal view. C . Head in full-face view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species has been collected in forest clearings, in weedy areas, in savanna on white clay soil, dry forest savanna, Thornveld savanna, Kimberley Thornveld, Miombo woodland, riverine-grassveld, old tobacco fields, sandy soil areas dominated by shrubs, and in citrus orchards.
Tetramorium setuliferum
normally nests in sandy to loamy soils, with nest entrances found in open areas. Circles of grass seed husks, piles of small stones or scattered soil particles have been found around nest entrances. Seeds are regularly found in nests. Reproductive forms have been collected from nests between October and February. Collected using pitfall traps, tuna baits, and sugar baits.
